Class netscape.application.TextViewHTMLString 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----netscape.application.TextViewHTMLElement
           |
           +----netscape.application.TextViewHTMLString
public class TextViewHTMLString
extends TextViewHTMLElement
Instances of this class are used to store strings while converting HTML to strings and attributes. If you need to add some processing on strings, subclass TextViewHTMLString and use TextView.setHTMLStringClass() to tell TextView to use your subclass.

TextViewHTMLString()

setAttributes(String)
setChildren(Object[])
setMarker(String)
setString(String)
When parsing HTML, TextView will allocate an instance of the HTML string class for each strings and then call setString() on it.
string()
Return the string
string(Hashtable)
Return the string for the component, given the context context override this method if you want to perform some computation on the string according to context.
toString()

 public String string(Hashtable context)
Return the string for the component, given the context context override this method if you want to perform some computation on the string according to context. The default implementation is equivalent to string()
